title: Seat - Adjustment

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
To prevent damage to the seats or seat covers, care must be taken not to drop the seats.

Do not lean the seats against the motorcycle or any surface which may damage the seats or seat covers. Instead, place the seats, with the seat cover facing upwards, on a clean, flat surface which is covered with a soft cloth.
Do not place any item on the seats which may cause damage or staining to the seat covers.
The seat assembly can be adjusted for position along the seat mount by up to 30 mm.
Loosen, but do not remove, the left hand side fixing.
Tilt the seat assembly upwards to gain access to the underside of the seat.
Loosen, but do not remove, the two nuts underneath the seat assembly.
Slide the seat along the seat mount to the desired position.
Rotate the seat back to its original position and install the front seat fixing. Ensure the front of the seat mount is in contact with the frame.
